summary: SummaryHighlightsCruelty FreeVegane.l.f. Cosmetics Squeeze Me Lip Balm helps hydrate and nourish lips with a sheer tint of color. Enriched with lip-loving ingredients like Hyaluronic acid, shea butter, and goji berry, this leave-on lip balm is perfect for getting a boost of moisture wherever you are.
details: DetailsBenefitsLightweight, leave-on formula helps hydrate & nourish lipsSheer tint of colorPocket-sized, easy-to-use squeeze tube & applicator for when you're on the goAvailable in various delicious scents & shades100% vegan, cruelty-free & Leaping Bunny CertifiedMade in a Fair-Trade Certified factoryKey IngredientsShea butterHyaluronic acidGoji berryFormulated WithoutPhthalatesParabensNonylphenol ethoxylatesTriclosanTriclocarbanHydroquinoneItem 2611156How To UseApply a generous even layer directly to lips. Reapply as needed.Pro Tip: Prep your lips with e.l.f. Cosmetics' Lip Exfoliator (sold separately).IngredientsTriisostearin, Hydrogenated Polyisobutene, Polyglyceryl-10 Pentaisostearate, Dextrin Palmitate, Ethylhexylglycerin, Diethylhexyl Syringylidenemalonate, Fragrance (Parfum), Squalane, Simethicone, Caprylic/Capric Triglyceride, Butyrospermum Parkii (Shea Butter), Water (Aqua), Ricinus Communis (Castor) Seed Oil, Butylene Glycol, Glycerin, Tocopherol, Sodium Hyaluronate, Maltodextrin, Hydrogenated Castor Oil, Lycium Chinense Fruit Extract, 1,2- Hexanediol, Calcium Pantothenate, Xanthan Gum, Urea, Caprylyl Glycol, Magnesium Lactate, Papain, Soluble Collagen, Potassium Lactate, Proline, Alanine, Serine, Magnesium Chloride, Sodium Citrate, Benzyl Benzoate, Cinnamyl Alcohol. May Contain: Titanium Dioxide (CI 77891), Yellow Iron Oxide (CI 77492).<Ingredients may change or vary from time to time. Please refer to the packaging of the product received for the list of ingredients in your particular product.
how_to_use: Apply a generous even layer directly to lips. Reapply as needed.Pro Tip: Prep your lips with e.l.f. Cosmetics' Lip Exfoliator (sold separately).

reviews.headline: BUY THE VANILLA NOW
reviews.comments: Better than the Laneige tubes. I like their lip masks, but this is a great dupe. The vanilla is 10/10/10 YUMMY. Smells like a candle in the best way, but doesn't taste like one. I get migraines but the scent does not bother me. Lasts all night and doesn't burn. I get chilitis in the winter and can only use this and a few other brands. I have bought the vanilla multiple times and have bought it for friends who have loved it. Everyone who's tried it that I have recommended it to has LOVED it. Honestly I need to be paid by Elf at this point lol.

reviews.headline: I would definitely repurchase
reviews.comments: I got 3 of these and I and OBSESSED! It says it is a lip balm but it is really a lip balm and lip gloss in one. It gives your lips such great hydration and the prettiest glossy finish. I would recommend this 100% for school emergency packs or just to keep in your pocket at all times!

reviews.headline: I found the one!
reviews.comments: Amazing lip balm! Usually all lip balms crack my lips leading to lip peeling. Not this one! This one hydrates them and does not crack them at all!

faceoff_positive.comments:
For the price point, this is a lovely moisturizing dupe for the basic tube balms offered for 5x the cost by luxury brands. The fragrance is yummy without being overwhelming and the mango reminds me of the mango fragrance by The Body Shop. They fit perfectly in your pocket and are about half the size of the Ole Hendriksen peptide balm tubes, which I find to be too large.

They have good slip and just feel nice on the lips, though my lips seem to absorb them quickly so I have to apply more often than I would like. The texture they most remind me of are the Laneige glowy balms and Mario Badescue tube balm. These e.l.f glosses are lighter than glosses like Lanolips, Glossier Balm Dotcom, and Summer Fridays.
faceoff_positive.headline: Perfect pocket size

faceoff_negative.comments: I ordered the shade peach since the others were sold out, but I love peach scents so no love lost. This is DEFINITELY trying to be a dupe for another lip balm out there. I don't think it's dupe worthy but I think it's a decent lip balm with a nice scent. Mine looks like it's about the size of a sample of foundation or bb cream, but the tube is only a little more than half filled. I like the squeeze tube, and the product comes out relatively easy. There is NO tint whatsoever in the peach shade, it looks like it would have one and it did claim a sheer tint but there was nothing on my lips or my arm (I tried to swatch it but it's just clear), so don't expect a tint from this. The product it's supposed to be "duping" has a couple different butters in it's formula but this one has only one and castor oil, with a few other basic ingredients. Is it a dupe? Not imo. Is it a good balm on a budget? Yea, and with a lip oil on top it feels pretty hydrating for the price, so it's a solid budget lip balm. I don't know that it will last long though since you would use a lot more product and the tube isn't filled completely so, keep that in mind.
faceoff_negative.headline: It's a good lip balm
